We are a research group (also a CTF team) at the Kyunghee University, Computer Science/Engineering Department. Our aim is to effectively discover security vulnerabilities in various system software, including operating system, web server/application, embedded system, and so forth.

Previous Next

To this end, we analyze system software and develope fuzzing/reverse-engineering platform for finding security-bugs (see Research). Also, we play CTF/Wargame just for fun.

Recommended Wargame List

  • w3challs.com
  • pwnable.kr
  • pwnable.tw
  • pwnable.xyz
  • reversing.kr
  • webhacking.kr
  • rootme

Recommended CTF List

  • DEFCON CTF
  • SECCON CTF
  • CODEGATE CTF
  • HITCON CTF
  • Plaid CTF
  • Google CTF
  • Dragon CTF
  • Tokyo Western CTF
  • Hack.lu CTF
  • ASIS CTF
  • HXP

We are looking for passionate CTF player, Grad students to join the team (more info) !

Our lab is funded by the following organizations.

News

23. May 2022

TEST Two new papers on arXiv! One on persistent gaps and non-mean-field breakdown of SC, and one on shot-noise of individual (putative) Majorana modes.

Milan wins an ERC CoG grant! See Leiden news.

Our new paper, on Cooper pairs above Tc, is published in Science. See SRON news, TU Delft news, Leiden news, Physics World.
